author: Special Correspondent
text:
He has collected 10,000 non-carious teeth

For the records:Dentist Jibreel Oysul of Meenakshi Mission Hospital and Research Centre, Madurai, who has extracted, processed and collected 10,000 non-carious human teeth since January 2011, displaying them to media persons on Thursday.— Photo: G. Moorthy

Jibreel Oysul, chief of dental surgery unit in Meenakshi Mission Hospital and Research Centre here, has entered Limca Book of Records 2016 for the “most extraction and the largest collection of non-carious human teeth.”

Speaking to media persons on Thursday, Dr. Oysul said that he had extracted, processed and collected 10,000 teeth since January 2011, for study and research purposes in the hospital. He realised that many patients had lost their good teeth due to bad gums than dental caries. “We can overcome this situation by doing regular dental check-up and scaling. By brushing twice a day the teeth can be taken care of,” he noted.

Thanking his team and hospital founder N. Sethuraman for according support and space to carry out such a voluminous study over the past five years, he said that food habits, proper chewing and cleaning of mouth after consuming eatables would keep the teeth in good form.

Age was not a factor as even a 30-year-old might lose teeth.

Dr. Oysul recommended use of soft tooth brush than hard or medium brushes. Likewise, he recommended changing tooth brush every 90 days.

Improper brushing may change not only the tooth alignment but may gradually lead to change in the face structure of an individual.

The State government should set a model by including dental awareness at the primary school level. The hospital, he said, had been conducting free dental camps in schools in the region as it was important to educate people on the need for clean teeth from childhood. Every Wednesday, the MMHRC offered free dental screening between 9 a.m. and 1 p.m. for the last 10 years, he informed.

On the apprehensions about dental scaling, he said that there was no harm in scaling once a year and it would not take out the enamel.

Using ultrasonic vibrator, the dirt or food particles would be removed within 15 minutes.

He clarified that any dentist would only protect teeth and not remove them, which would be done as a last resort.
title: Madurai dentist enters Limca Book of Records
